item.title: Black Music Action Coalitionが発表した、音楽業界の人種的不公平への対応に関する2022年のレポートカードでは、一部の音楽レーベルに懸念が示されています（Elias Leight/Billboard)
item.description:
Elias Leight / Billboard:
The Black Music Action Coalition's 2022 report card on the music industry's progress toward addressing racial inequity expresses concern over some music labels  —  The Black Music Action Coalition (BMAC) unveiled a tepid assessment of the music industry's progress toward addressing historical racism and inequity on Monday (May 15).

item.title: Artifactの新しいライター機能、ニュースアプリの成長の鍵となるライターへのサービス、消費者とライターのマッチングなどについて、Kevin Systromにインタビュー（Darrell Etherington/TechCrunch)
item.description:
Darrell Etherington / TechCrunch:
An interview with Kevin Systrom on Artifact's new writer features, serving writers as a key to the news app's growth, matching consumers with writers, and more  —  Artifact aims to unlock new, cross-platform audience relationships for people who write for a living

item.title: ニールセンCNNは、トランプのタウンホールから2日後の金曜日のゴールデンタイムに平均335Kの視聴者を獲得し、Newsmaxの357K、MSNBCの110M、Fox Newsの140Mの視聴者に後れを取った（Ross A. Lincoln/The Wrap）．
item.description:
Ross A. Lincoln / The Wrap:
Nielsen: CNN averaged 335K viewers during Friday's primetime, two days after Trump's town hall, behind Newsmax's 357K, MSNBC's 1.1M, and Fox News' 1.4M viewers  —  CNN pulled on average 335,000 viewers — 18,000 less than Newsmax  —  CNN might have earned itself a rare primetime ratings win …

item.title: 2023年のアップフロントの様子、金融サービスやテック系の広告主の支出が後退する中、TVネットワークはスポーツやストリーミングを強調するようだ（Brian Steinberg/Variety)
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
A look at the 2023 upfronts, as TV networks are likely to highlight sports and streaming, amid a pullback in spending by financial services and tech advertisers  —  Plenty of money will be spent on TV ads during this year's “upfront” — but probably not enough to fuel the economics of all the nation's big media conglomerates.

item.title: The GuardianのEIC Katharine Vinerによると、同店の調査チームは2015年から「約4倍」に増え、近々米国の調査チームを立ち上げる予定だ（William Turvill/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
William Turvill / Press Gazette:
The Guardian EIC Katharine Viner says the outlet's investigative team has grown “about four times” since 2015 and plans to launch a US investigations team soon  —  Katharine Viner said The Guardian's is “a really inspiring model for investigative journalism”.

item.title: Viceの破産申請では、CNN Productionsが$3.8M請求、HBOが$1.8M請求、A&E Networksが$938K請求など、5000人以上の債権者を推定している（Erik Hayden/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Erik Hayden / The Hollywood Reporter:
Vice's bankruptcy filing estimates 5,000+ creditors, including CNN Productions with a $3.8M claim, HBO with a $1.8M claim, and A&E Networks with a $938K claim  —  The Brooklyn-based media conglomerate filed for Chapter 11 after multiple capital raises, $834 million in debt obligations and a scuttled plan to go public.

item.title: NFLが、来シーズンのプレーオフの試合をPeacockが独占的に配信する契約を締結（情報筋によると1億1000万ドル相当）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
The NFL strikes a deal, sources say worth ~$110M, to have Peacock carry a playoff game next season, the first time a postseason game would stream exclusively  —  Deal marks first time an NFL playoff game will mostly be available on a streaming service  —  The National Football League …

item.title: 16億ドル以上を調達し、2017年のピーク時には57億ドルの評価を受け、Refinery29、Virtue、Vice Studiosなど多数の資産を所有するVice Mediaの歴史（Sara Fischer/Axios）。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
A history of Vice Media, which raised $1.6B+, was valued at $5.7B at its peak in 2017, and owns a slew of assets, including Refinery29, Virtue, and Vice Studios  —  Vice Media Group filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy early Monday morning, marking the end of a long, strenuous effort to sell itself after its business stopped growing.

item.title: BTS、ジャスティン・ビーバー、アリアナ・グランデを擁する韓国の音楽会社Hybeは、音声AIを使って最新アーティストMidnattを6カ国語で同時発売（David Salazar/Fast Company）
item.description:
David Salazar / Fast Company:
South Korean music company Hybe, behind BTS, Justin Bieber, and Ariana Grande, uses voice AI to launch its latest artist Midnatt in six languages simultaneously  —  When Hybe, the entertainment juggernaut behind the K-pop group BTS, announces a new artist, the music world takes note.

item.title: MoffettNathanson：2023年第1四半期の米国有料テレビユーザーは前年同期比7％減の75.5M、世帯普及率は58.5％と1992年以来の低水準、第1四半期はYouTube TVだけが成長（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
MoffettNathanson: US pay TV users fell 7% YoY to 75.5M in Q1 2023, with household penetration at 58.5%, the lowest level since 1992; only YouTube TV grew in Q1  —  As streaming video continues its ascendancy, cable, satellite and internet TV providers in the U.S. turned in their worst subscriber losses …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズの発行人が、人を怒らせる覚悟があってこそ達成できる、ジャーナリズムの独立性と客観性の価値について考察する（A.G. Sulzberger/Columbia Journalism ...)
item.description:
A.G. Sulzberger / Columbia Journalism Review:
The New York Times' publisher examines the value of journalistic independence and objectivity, which he says are only achieved by being prepared to upset people  —  The debate around “objectivity”—if that's even the right word, anymore—has become among the most contested in journalism.

item.title: Jimmy Finkelstein、無料で読めるデジタルニュース「The Messenger」をデビューさせる！2024年の売上は1億ドル以上、ジャーナリストは〜550人の雇用を目指すと報じられている（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Jimmy Finkelstein debuts his free-to-read digital news outlet The Messenger, which reportedly aims to generate $100M+ in 2024 revenue and hire ~550 journalists  —  The Messenger aims to make $100m in revenue next year with up to 550 journalists.  —  Jimmy Finkelstein's digital news start …

item.title: The Irish Timesが5月11日に掲載した、女性のフェイクタン使用に関する意見文が、AIを使って記事を作成したデマ投稿者により投稿されたことを謝罪（Rory Carroll/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Rory Carroll / The Guardian:
The Irish Times apologizes for running an opinion piece on May 11 about women's use of fake tan that was submitted by a hoaxer who created the article using AI  —  The piece ran on 11 May and accused people who use fake tan of mocking those with naturally dark skin

item.title: Pluto TVの共同創業者イリヤ・ポジンのTelly、広告を常時表示するためのセカンドスクリーンを備えた55インチ4K HDRテレビを2023年に500K台プレゼントするためのウェイティングリストをオープン（Jared Newman/Fast Company）。
item.description:
Jared Newman / Fast Company:
Pluto TV co-founder Ilya Pozin's Telly opens a waitlist to give away 500K 55-inch 4K HDR TVs, which have a second screen for constantly showing ads, in 2023  —  Would you take a free TV if it constantly ran banner ads beneath everything you watched?  —  That's the proposition for Telly …

item.title: アンテナ：2023年2月にNetflix、Disney+、HBO Maxに加入した米国の加入者のうち～25％が広告を選択、米国の加入者のうち～58％が少なくとも一つの広告付きサービスに支払っている（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Antenna: ~25% of US subscribers to Netflix, Disney+, and HBO Max in February 2023 chose ads; ~58% of US subscribers pay for at least one ad-supported service  —  Good afternoon from New York.  We're entering week three of the Hollywood writers strike and there's been no progress.
